body.p: To his excellency Gov Magoffin Governor of Ky.

Your Petitioners would humbly represent to your Excellency that they have been fined the sums of money to-wit: -- Lewis Kring the sum of Fifty dollars and costs; Henry I Lavell the sum of Twenty dollars and costs. The said fines were imposed by the Police Court of Frankfort Judge Graham presiding, for the offence of a breach of the Peace in Frankfort, committed April 21st 1862 by engaging in a fight -- and tried the same day before said court and fined therefor as aforesaid.

Your Petitioners would represent that they are poor boys in the employ of E H Steadman at his paper-mill -- this being the only means they have of support. Lewis Kring one of your Petitioners being a cripple and having a mother and two children to support out of the means he gets from his Employer E H Steadman.
They are unable to pay said fines. Wherefore they pray for the clemency of your Excellency in the remittal of the said fines
Sworn to before me by Louis Kring and Henry J Savell April 22d 1862
We the undersigned concur in the belief that the above fines ought to be remitted.

Jno Rodman
Eugene P. Moore.
W, J, Chinn
J, W, South
W. S. Dehony
W H Greenup
